history.content:
Speaking for 161 - we are not planning to require live attendance (exams will most likely be a set time though) so in theory you could take the class w/ an internship.

That being said, realize that the summer courses are essentially a normal semester squished into half the time. As such, you can expect the workload to be twice that of a normal technical class during the semester. How much of a time commitment that is completely depends on you :)

Personally, I would not recommend doing full time + 161, but for some it may be doable!

--------

CS 169 summer instructor here: No, attendance will not be required. Similar to 161, our exams will  be at a set time, too. I think I agree with Ryan on taking these classes concurrently with an internship. It's a lot to go through in 8 weeks!

Speaking for 161 - we are not planning to require live attendance (exams will most likely be a set time though) so in theory you could take the class w/ an internship.

That being said, realize that the summer courses are essentially a normal semester squished into half the time. As such, you can expect the workload to be twice that of a normal technical class during the semester. How much of a time commitment that is completely depends on you :)

Personally, I would not recommend doing full time + 161, but for some it may be doable!

Taking two tech classes in summer term is a similar workload each week as taking four techs in fall or spring. 

Would you do that plus working full time in a normal fall or spring semester?

Generally, it seems like a bad idea but you'll have to make that call for yourself.

Taking two tech classes in summer term is a similar workload each week as taking four techs in fall or spring. 

Would do that plus working full time in a normal fall or spring semester?

Generally, it seems like a bad idea but you'll have to make that call for yourself.

I just read the email that summer classes will be online. I have a full time internship this summer, but it might be remote as well, so I'm considering taking summer session classes. Since they'll be webcasted, I was wondering if there's any confirmation of whether 161/169 will require live attendance or if things can be done at our own time of the day?

Also, has anyone here experienced a summer session of either 161 or 169? How was the workload? How were office hours/projects?

I know that people on Piazza said they don't recommend taking 2 techs with any other summer activities because of the workload, but I'm aiming for around a B in the tech and P/NP some breadth, and with my internship perhaps being remote this may be a good option since it'll allow me to graduate early. But I just don't really know how fast tech courses go and I want to make the best decision. I'd appreciate your input on this if you've done summer classes.

Thanks!
history.subject: Summer Classes 2020, webcast, workload 169/161?
